Reviews.Title: “wonderful find!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleClaudette
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in San Marco, on a small canal just near La Fenice Theater. We stayed for three nights during a recent short trip to italy and absolutely loved it. It is charming, well-located, clean and has a wonderful staff. We had airy rooms over the canal, well-decorated and with very high end bathrooms. While there is no restaurant, there is a very nice breakfast served on the top floor, and there is wide choice of nearby places to eat. We arrived and left by water taxi, arranged by the helpful staff. I can't think of any reason to pay more for a hotel in Venice when this one is available!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Emma J
Reviews.Content: *Receptionists were really kind, helpful and made some great recommendations on things to do and where to eat! Wouldn't of had the experiences we had without them! *The hotel was very clean and nicely presented! The room we stayed in was big, airy and of a high standard. Big bathroom and had a reasonably priced mini bar in the room! *Breakfast was lovely with a good choice of food available..ranging from croissants, to toast, to cereals, to fruit and biscuits etc. *We were allowed to check in early and once we had checked out we could leave our bags there in a safe place, whilst we waited for our water taxi to pick us up a few hours later. *The hotel is in a good location and if you get a water taxi you can get dropped off right outside which means no walking round looking for it! It is less then 5 minutes walk from St Marco's Square and about 15 minutes from the grand canal. The best way to explore is by getting lost (but make sure you have a map at all times!!) *They also have a roof terrace which is a help your self bar and this is a lovely place to sit and have a drink! Absolutley loved our stay in Venice..so much so we didnt want to come home! Would definatley go again :) Thankyou Dell'opera for making our stay so nice!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Anissesofia
Reviews.Content: From the location, to the room to the incredibly helpful staff, this has to be one of the best little hotels in Venice just round the corner from San Marco Square. The room was huge, the bathroom spotless. Our room overlooked the canal and was just charming. This is not a 5 star soul-less chain hotel, so don't expect high-luxury blandness or silly Ã¼ber-design. The furniture is an eclectic mix that feels relaxed and is in good taste - but it's not trying to make a statement. One of best things about the hotel is the staff who are so friendly and helpful. Everyone on the front desk shone - always helpful with restaurant recommendations and reservations. Free wi-fi as well. We almost don't want to tell anyone about this hotel for fear of making it too popular.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Khangela
Reviews.Content: Perfect, small hotel (15 rooms) in the immediate vicinity, 5 minutes walk, from Piazza San Marco and therefore in an excellent location, with respect to restaurants, shops and boarding point of the ferry/vaporetto. It's kind of hard to find if you get of vaporetto station Giglio. I had room No 106, traditionally furnished, with a separate sitting area and ample hanging and storage space. The room is overlooking Canal / Rio delle Veste. The bathroom is small, with only a shower, whilst the shower cubicle is a little too tight. Everything looks neat and well maintained. The staff were very welcoming, friendly and helpful. The breakfast room is a bit cramped and they serve a very satisfactory breakfast buffet. I have experienced no noise from outside or adjacent rooms. The hotel offers free WiFi for 72 actual hours. Altogether dell'Opera is a very pleasant hotel in a perfect loactie.

Reviews.Title: “The charm of Venice without the noise...”
Reviews.Author: hcase
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel dell'Opera. After a delightful water taxi ride, we landed right in front of our hotel. The front desk staff was very helpful with suggestions of where to wonder to, where to eat and even assisted us (4 ladies) with luggage. The rooms are decent size rooms for Europe, very unique and clean. Your night stay includes a breakfast which was well rounded with pastries, eggs, cereal, fruit, beverages etc... and the roof top Additionally, their Honor bar is great. It is a darling terrace that we loved to enjoy a dusk cocktail and listen to the church bells. Situated on a quiet canal, you have the charm of Venice without the noise. The best part of the hotel is the location, it is tucked away so you are not on any noisy main streets but a 5 min walk to either St Marks or Rialto. Great little gem, we would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: piekarczyk
Reviews.Content: If you want faceless service then stay at a 5 star! If you want friendly,helpful and totally professional service then stay here. It's all been said before - excellent location,clean comfortable rooms,great breakfast. What more can I add? Our initial classic room was very well presented complete with private terrace overlooking a canal but had no bath (an essential for me when in Venice ). the hotel was full but the next day we were moved to a superior room again with a private terrace and the cherished bath at no extra charge. If you are planning to visit Venice stay here and you wont be disappointed. A very big thankyou to all the staff for making this a very memorable stay

Reviews.Title: “Top location, a very sweet little hotel at a reasonable rate.”
Reviews.Author: MelJamo
Reviews.Content: Apart from the rooms being overheated, which I find a general problem across Italy in winter, I could not fault this hotel. It was well located, five mins to San Marco Piazza but very quiet. The breakfasts were excellent, the room large, free wifi, and very clean. I would highly recommend this hotel, if you want something nice but inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small hotel”
Reviews.Author: K S
Reviews.Content: Hoel dell'Opera is a small hotel, in a good location, very near San Marco, yet out of the way. Room was large with comfortable furniture and bed. A small balcony with a view of one of the small canals was very attractive. The bathroom although modern was very tiny especially the shower. Breakfast is self- serve and served in a small room with very tiny tables that are uncomfortable. Breakfast was OK, with the usual breakfast items, cereal, meats, pastries (very good) and eggs. The eggs were terrible though. They need a new recipe for scrambled eggs or a new cook. Personal service and helpful staff. Upon arrival we were greeted by Enrico, a very personable and very polite young man. The rooftop 'terrace' is not a terrace at all, but a very, very small balcony that should not be advertised as a terrace. Overall, it is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hidded, nice,the opera is just around the corner”
Reviews.Author: vimu2008
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite hidden, so it is good to have the hotel tel. nr and to make yourself a print of the map on which you design the road to take, in advance. If you intent to go to the opera (a wonderful experience) it is just around the corner. The breakfast is simple, the rooms are nice, simple, clean, quite big . The hotel is facing a small channel, the gondole are passing right under your window. From the little roof terrace you can look in the evening to the sky , enjoy the sounds of the city and a glass of wine. The only problem i had was, we gave the reception a list of 3 restaurants to book for us a table, and he did not inform us that the only table he got was outside. In october, in the evening, outside is cold, even if they try to heat, and if we knew we would had dressed better.

Reviews.Title: “A good small hotel”
Reviews.Author: BJC883
Reviews.Content: Wife and I, sightseeing. Good hotel and well placed, service very good and food also good. Not exactly panoramic roof top terrace but a nice little area for supping Presecco. The double room (think it must have been a classic) we had was fine but not as good as those on their website, very plain but we didn't expect much for 3 stars over looking a "courtyard"- laundary :) typical Venice. So if you want "romantic stay" go for the other rooms, but that said a very good place to stay for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Punatravels
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and friendly. Loved that we had free internet access because it's the only contact we had with our travel agent since we couldn't use our phones for international calling. Our room was beautiful with a private terrace. At night we could hear the Gondola singers sing as they row past the hotel. Breakfast was awesome! I stuffed myself with the yummy sausages and apricot croissants! Our travel plans got messed up because of a Greece strike at the airport.... and the hotel staff was very helpful with accommodating us. My partner and I was very pleased with this hotel. We would definitely stay there again. It's only a 5 minute walk from the main San Marco square. So convenient.

Reviews.Title: “I would give it 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Jetscot
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Trip Advisor, we booked this hotel at short notice. We had no idea how to get there from the airport so I contacted the hotel concierge, who got back to me very quickly with our options. Although they said they needed 3 days to arrange transfers, they did it within a couple of hours. On arrival we were given an upgraded room, overlooking the canal, which contained a bottle of Prosecco on ice. The room was large with a lovely, small, modern bathroom. The buffet breakfast was in a small room on the second floor. There was a great choice which included rolls, croissant, cakes, biscuits, yoghurt, juices, cereal and a freshly made fruit salad. Also 2 hot choices. There is a very small roof top terrace, reached by climbing a narrow staircase, with 2 tables and four chairs, and a well stocked honesty bar with fridge/freezer containing beer, soft drinks and mixers, a bottle of frozen Vodka and ice cubes. The prices in Venice are ridiculously expensive, but this hotel was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in great location”
Reviews.Author: flannan
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nites on our first trip to Venice. I had agonizzed over choosing a hotel based on TA reviews but couldn't have made a better choice. It was about a 6 minute walk from the vaporetto stop. Tucked away on a small pretty canal, which made it very quiet and relaxing, but only steps to St Mark's Square, the Doge's Palace and high end shops. Actually, very easy to get anywhere in Venice from the central location. It was very easy to find with the directions they provide. The room's excellent size and decor was just as pictured on the website; spotlessly clean with a deep bath. We had a small balcony off the room which was lovely; enjoyed sitting and looking out at the roofs and windows of Venice and the fat cat sunning in the window across the way. It was also of use to hang out some washing. The roof terrace is small but the honesty bar is packed with anything you could want. The breakfast room is bright and pretty; small touches of decor in keeping with the rest of the hotel. Everything on offer was delicious and fresh. Finally, the staff, especially Enrico, was genuinely friendly. He directed us to a fantastic little trattoria in Castello, Oliva Nera, which was one of the most enjoyable meals of our trip. In addition, Enrico was great to chat with about how daily life works in Venice. Overall, I was thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Dell Opera and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: sherburnninja
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a 4 day break and stay at Hotel Dell'Opera and will be returning again! My wife and I were warmly welcomed by friendly and helpful staff who kindly upgraded our room to a king size overlooking the canal which had fabulous views of the Gondoliers passing by. Our room was very grand with marble floors, huge comfortable bed, fab bathroom with a great power shower, well stocked mini bar, very clean and comfortable. The breakfast room was great with a very good selection of scrambled eggs (yummy) sausages, an array of cold meats, toast & cereals, fresh blood red orange juice, pineapple and grapefruit, cakes and apricot croissants (my favourite) The staff are very helpful, smart and speak very good English, good sense of humour too! The roof terrace was a great place to unwind and relax after walking miles through the wonderful streets of Venice, Grab a beer, wine or spirits at the rooftop bar (honesty bar) and star gaze over the coloured rooftop tiles. A few mins walk from St Marks Square and all its beauty. Fantastic hotel and we will be be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Definately recommended !”
Reviews.Author: Gail360
Reviews.Content: We were only in Venice for 2 days and decided to stay at the Hotel Dell'Opera due to it's location (only 5 minutes walk from St Marks Square and the Vaporetto stop). It's not a huge hotel and this is reflected in the personal service and warm welcome you receive on arrival. We asked for a room with a view and for only a small amount of Euro's extra, were offered an amazing room with a canal view, 4 poster bed and huge sofa. The hotel has free internet plus a computer and printer on the top floor for residents use. In addition, there is an 'honesty bar' - stocked with everything you can think of - to enjoy on the balcony overlooking the rooftops of Venice. Continental breakfast consisted of cereals, toast, croissants, eggs, yoghurt etc.... which was more than adequate for the day ahead. The staff couldn't be friendlier and went out of their way to ensure we had everything we needed. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to any visitors to Venice. Note - When visiting Italy, make sure you bring your own travel iron. It's against the law to use Irons in the rooms so it's virtually impossible to get the hotel to loan you one. The only way to get anything ironed is to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and friendly hotel in an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: inGlasgow
Reviews.Content: After much deliberation we chose this hotel as the base for our wedding in Venice as it had exactly the location that we needed and so many good reviews on TripAdvisor.. We are glad that we did. It is a small hotel but the staff could not have been any kinder or more generous to us. The hotel is clean, the rooms a decent size for Venice and the breakfast is a very nice buffet, however the thing that would make us return was the service and relaxed atmosphere away from the bustle of the city streets. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel or to come back in the future. What to expect: - Small hotel but decent sized rooms for this location in Venice. - Clean with excellent modern bathroom and shower. - Charming balconies in some rooms with a small canal view and live music from passing Gondoliers! - Lovely buffet breakfast. - Tiny but lovely rooftop honesty bar that can set 4 - 8 people.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel, superb staff, very welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: Albanys
Reviews.Content: Reception staff are extremely helpful and courteous. Our stay here was very restful. Charming rooftop seating for an evening drink. Breakfasts excellent with plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “boutique style, great location, average rooms, hard beds”
Reviews.Author: LadyGaga38
Reviews.Content: great location near st marks with an excellent wine bar adjacent. Very quaint. Room was very dark as faced another building side on, No full length mirror, small bathroom. Breakfast was average, and served in a small room with tables close to each other. Honest bar at top of hotel offers a nice view but v small so only would fit 2 couples. Free internet is a great offering.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable room in good location”
Reviews.Author: denisjojo
Reviews.Content: I am starting to get very sceptical about tripadvisors' reviews - which is very disappointing. We thought we got a fantastic deal at Â£160 (about 180 Euros) per night for a very highly rated hotel on Tripadvisor. Excited, that is, until we actually saw the room - a miserable pokey room with zero view (the window looks into directly into a wall & windows of another building). It does have a flat screen tv (which must be standard issue in this hotel) which we never switched on and a creepy door leading presumably to another room. I complained immediately at the downstairs office and they said politely sorry that is what you get for a standard double room. Separately I asked for a couple of other routine requests that I would have thought a hotel should be able to service and they politely said no they could not help - no effort was made to assist. I will acknowledge some positives - nice modern bathroom (although the door leading to the bathroom had a dirty black mark on it), beds were ok, breakfast ok, also they did not charge for the water we had from the mini bar. Overall, nice central location but poor room.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location.”
Reviews.Author: iainseville
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after days of trawling Tripadvisor and other websites to pick a hotel for a surprise birthday trip to Venice. I booked it as a package with my flight from the BA website. As a result they were only able to offer standard rooms. As I was hoping for a room with a view, I contacted the hotel shortly before. Unfortunately, they were full and told me that they would only have the original room. Fair enough. However, when we arrived, I mentioned to the receptionist on the off chance that one had become available, and lucky us, it had. We were therefore given a room with a canal view at no extra charge, and we couldn't have been happier. Our room was on the top floor, and from our windows we could look up and down a typical Venetian canal. Over the rooftops in front, we could see the church of Santa Maria della Salute, one of Venices most iconic landmarks. In general, we were happy with our room. It was quite large and very clean. The decoration was contemporary and simply. Our only problem was that the mattresses and pillows were hard. But that's a personal choice. The service in the hotel was exceptional. All of the staff were very happy to give advice and tips to get the most of your stay. If they didn't know the answer to your question they would find out. On two occasions we had restaurant recommendations, both of which were just what we were looking for. You genuinely felt like a welcome guest. Breakfast was surprising. I expected a few platters of cold meats and bread. There is actually a hot selection of sausages and scrambled egg. This is great, as Venice can be tiring with all the walking and so you feel much better set up at the beginning of the day. My one piece of feedback to the hotel would be about the wi-fi. It's free to use, but you must get a password from reception. This access only last 5 hours, which for a couple of days is fine, but we were there for 5, and found that we had to keep asking for a new password. I think it would be easier and more customer-friendly if the system simply had a log-on password that you could use as and when without the need for a different password every 5 hours. I would definitely stay here again if I return to Venice. It ticks all the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “a comfortable and friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: luvetotravel1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in great location.. in the heart of San Marco (right off the nice shopping district). It was very clean and quiet. The staffs were very knowledgeable and friendly. They even seem to go out of their way to help you out if in need. If I come back to Venice next time, I would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “So pretty, tasteful, and well-staffed! But not close to the vaporetto when you have bags.”
Reviews.Author: metalauren
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so pretty and elegant in an understated way. With big windows and lots of marble, it was obviously once a very opulent home. I had a huge room (they call it superior) overlooking the small canal it's on. It had a king size bed and a twin size daybed as a sofa. The staff was very helpful and friendly, and the usual continental breakfast had a bit more variety than a lot of other hotels I stayed in Italy with a very attentive waitress. Go to their website-- it was cheaper than listed on Expedia. The directions they give you when you make your reservation weren't very helpful, so try to map it yourself. For example, they said "Cross Vallaresso Street" but it turned out what they meant was follow it from beginning to end. It isn't close to the Vaporetto, so careful if you're saddled with a lot of luggage because you'll go up and down several bridges, but otherwise it is a fantastic location. The sign is kind of easy to miss, too, so follow your map carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay while in Venice”
Reviews.Author: revproj
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated next to the Teatro Venice opera house and a short walk from San Marco plaza and a nice shopping area. The location is perfect for the value and price of staying at the hotel. The Rialto Bridge is only about a 10-15 minute walk and there are plenty of signs to guide you along the way. Upon checking in, we were assisted by Ivan who was more than friendly, helpful and honest during our stay to inform us of activities in the area. We had attempted to check-in around 10:30 to which we were told the room would only be available at 2 PM. We didn't mind this as we had just arrived in Venice and there was plenty to see and do during that time. I had made the reservation on Otel.com to which I was a bit reluctant as I had never made a reservation on there before but found an incredible rate for a weekend in Venice in a central location. It ended working out great and I was able to get the room at an outstanding price. The room we were given(although a Standard room) had a private balcony with a small breakfast table overlooking the canal. It was very pleasant to sit out on the balcony and listen or watch some of the gondolas go. The room was also very spacious and comfortable and one of the nicer ones I stayed in during my visit to Italy. I could not be more pleased with the Hotel dell' Opera and my stay in Venice. It is understandable why it's well reviewed on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: pfhannan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the highlight of our 2 week trak through 4 countrys. I highly recomend it to all travelers

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: lorna1986
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in Hotel Dell'Opera and I would highly recommend it! It's in a great location (close to Rialto and St Marks Square). We did manage to lose our way on a few occasions but that is almost to be expected in Venice with its little lanes. We booked a superior room through the Hotels website (cheaper than any agent advertised) and upon arrival I was delighted to see that we had a room with a canal view. Although worth mentioning, this comes at the cost of some noise with people passing over the bridge outside and boats along the canal but this did not bother us in the slightest! The hotel was very quiet inside, we only ever met any other guests during breakfast. Upon arrival we were told that a complementary bottle of Prosseco was available to us when we so pleased and on our second night we mentioned this to the receptionist. He promptly brought it up to our room along with two wine glasses and a charming note wishing us a romantic stay in Venice. All in all we couldn't have asked for more... however, if we were to pick holes a suggestion would be made for a better designed shower- that flows vertically, not horizontally! But such a detail should not put anyone off! :) It was my second visit to Venice but first visit to Hotel Dell' Opera and if I was to return a third time I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with ideal location!!! STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonEyeLovers
Reviews.Content: We came to Venice to celebrate our 10th anniversary. Finding a hotel close to S. Marco is ideal for Venice and I recommend it to you in case you plan a 1 or 2 night stay in the city. If you stay away from S. Marco you will need to use the public (boat) transportation -the "vaporeto"-. It would be therefore better for short term visits to stay close to St. Marco. The Hotel dell'Opera location is indeed ideal and serves this purpose!! Its biggest strength is its location: 5 min walk to S. Marco square and 1 min from one of the finest/fanciest streets of Venice (with all impressive fashion shops). It is also 5 min. from the public (boat) transportation and therefore very convenient. I recommend that you follow the instructions (map info, etc) suggested from the hotel website -to avoid any trouble in fiding it, since Venice is truly a labyrinth-. We used the gondola waiting you at the entrance of the hotel!! It was magnificent and very romantic. DO NOT MISS THIS EXPERIENCE!! We stayed 2 nights in the weekend before the 2011 Feb. carnival (costed 200 euros per night) at the Superior Double room with view on the canal, inclusive of champagne at the arrival, trip to Murano island Glass factory, and buffet breakfast. Everything was fine. Nothing to worry. In terms of cleaniless, the hotel was well rennovated and bathroom/room was clean. Only the blankets were old/dirty -which the hotel might consider changing them at a certain point. But overall clean. I recommend this hotel for everyone want to relax in a nice romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but slight attention to a few points could make it excellent.”
Reviews.Author: timbo05
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very nice location down a side street just over a bridge. The decor and style of the hotel is very accurate as per the pics. Venitian yet contemporary. The staff were very friendly and helpfull and we were upgraded to canal view free of charge on arrival. This was nice but I wouldnt recommend paying the extra for what you actually get. Our room was next to the breakfast restaurant so from 6 every morning it was quite noisy, not from the hotel workers more from other gueats using the breakfast room. The room was very large with a tv, unfortunately the tv was small and on the furthest wall from the bed. Another point I found that goes against the hotel slightly is the non availabilty of irons (not good if you wanted to dress smartly for an evening meal and have just travelled with everything in a small suitcase) so please bear that in mind. Apparently the proximity to the opera house makes their insurance premiums too high to provide irons ??!! All in all I got a deal and got three nights for two so the cost of the rooms was very reasonable. I would hesitate to pay the full brochure price as I think maybe that is a little more than the room was worth but the offers that you can find make it extremely good value.

Reviews.Title: “Yes. Absolutely. I'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: ozmusoadel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel dell'Opera for six nights in January 2011. I have been to Venice many times before and stayed at a number of different hotels, but this one was by far the best. I will definitely be staying here again. The staff were very helpful and courteous, the rooms beautifully appointed and clean, the location very central and convenient, and the overall atmosphere calm and relaxing. The breakfast was very generous, the coffee was great. I was offered a complimentary coffee on check in which, considering how cold it was, was very much apprecaited. Free wifi internet access was a huge plus. If you're not familiar with Venice get the directions on how to find the hotel from the hotel's website (and confirm them with a good street map). These directions assume you have arrived at the San Marco / Vallaresso vaporetto stop near Harry's Bar (NOT the San Marco / San Zaccharia stop - that's a trap for the unwary). The mention of a "bar" in the hotel's amenitites is a little misleading, though. There is not a bar in the English-speaking sense of the word. The hotel uses the word to mean that coffee or drinks are available 24 hours a day and that these can be had in the breakfast room or in your room. There isn't a bar in which you can relax and meet with freinds at the end of the day as you might find in a larger establishment. I managed to score a four nights for the price of six deal (via the octopustravel.com website) which was not available on the hotel's own website, so this obviously was a plus. I would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: meeno
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location and easy to find once you know where you are going. The map on the website is good. The reception staff were not overly friendly with the exception of the blond haired gentleman (i forget his name) who was very nice. Rooms were very clean beds were so comfortable , i usually find it hard to sleep in some hotels but not here. Shower was too tiny and there was no bath so it was difficult with small children. View was not good. Breakfast was excellent, especially apricot croissants. Overall lovely hotel slightly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: franelen
Reviews.Content: Good small hotel in a central location. Not easy to find (get directions from website) but once you know where it is it proves to be in a great location - easy to walk to the main sites. Staff were very friendly and welcoming, very helpful. Our room was a good size and well furnished. In our opinion, the only downside was the breakfast. The food itself was good (especially the crispy croissants) but choice was very limited. There was only a choice of two cereals and, although there were eggs on offer (scrambled and boiled) these were cold. We appreciate that an Italian breakfast is not as full as we are used to in Britain but feel that more could be done to cater for our tastes. Venice, like most Italian cities, is very expensive although we did find places to eat that were failrly reasonable. Watch out for Italian habit of charging the potatoes and vegetables separately, this can add a fair amount to the bill. look out for menus that include the side dishes. We had a nice meal in the little restaurant next to the hotel. We would recommend this hotel and would return to it.

Reviews.Title: “Truely outstanding service, good central location”
Reviews.Author: SurfVB
Reviews.Content: Very nice room overlooking an interior canal, exceeded expectations! When hotel found out we were honeymooning, they gave us a free room upgrade and full bottle of champaign. Desk staff spoke good English and fulfilled every request. Nice breakfast everyday, better than any other we had during our trip to Italy. We looked at a number of hotels before we chose this one and I think that for the money, this is probably one of the best values in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch, attentive, service is what made us feel special!”
Reviews.Author: ebugeboo
Reviews.Content: Thank you to Giovanni and all of the staff at Hotel del' Opera who went above and beyond to attend to all of our needs! We were truly made to feel special. This lovely, small hotel was perfect for my elderly mother and myself with a wonderful staircase, Venetian Palazzo decor, comfortable beds, marble terrazzo floors and contemporary bath. Our room overlooked a small canal which had regular gondola traffic that would proceed under the small bridge. The canal provides perfect acoustics for the gondola singers- magical and entertaining to watch. We arrived in the small lobby jet-lagged and exhausted- Giovanni provided us with cold drinks, was highly sympathetic and made us feel very welcome. They took care of our bags, recommended restaurants and helped us with train schedules. We arrived to Piazza San Marco by WaterBus and there were porters waiting with carts who will take your bags to the hotel for 20 euros. This was a God-send for us as the hotel required crossing 2 bridges and my mother has a very bad back. Also, the hotel is tricky to find and, jet-lagged as we were, we probably would have wandered for hours- but the porter knew exactly where it was so it worked out very well. The hotel does not have a dedicated computer for guests but they allowed me to access my email behind the reservation desk : ) Breakfast was wonderful but it is the genteel manner of the staff that will bring me to this hotel again on my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service!”
Reviews.Author: Guy45
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a perfect service. Excellent and very friendly receptionists. They really do there very best to make your stay very nice. Breakfast is OK and the rooms are beautyfull. Location is excellent, at a few minutes from San Marco and 50 meters from the Fenice. Pitty that room 301 is noisy early in the morning because of the staff-room next to it (from 6 to 7 am).

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Hotel & great Service!”
Reviews.Author: LondonLynelle
Reviews.Content: Not at all hard to find, even in the pouring rain. Service was great. Location is great. Breakfast was delicous and a great selection. Room was gorgeous and spacious. The only gripe we had was the odd design of the bathroom. More than enough space but bizarrely the shower was just a curtain in the corner that I kept on getting tangled in and the entire bathroom floor would be under water by the end of the shower. Other than this oddity, our stay was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Venetian Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BruceJoan
Reviews.Content: Although it took us about an hour to find, even after asking a lady at an Art Shop who was only 50 mts away, only to find out that it used to be the home of a lawyer friend of hers, and only recently transformed into a beautiful, delightful and reasonable Boutique Hotel of only 15 rooms. Location was perfect, only 5 mins from Saint's Mark's Square,5 mins to the Grand Canal and the vaporetto boats that service the Grand Canal. The room while not large, was well equipped,clean and comfortable with great pillows plus we had our own balcony that overlooked a smaller canal that was regularly used by gondoliers, what more could you ask for in a true Venetian experience. Breakfast in the dinning room was a very relaxing experience, with a great choice for breakfast. Although we only had 2 nights there, it seemed like an eternity,brought about by the ambiance,decor and staff, very enjoyable. Only a short walk away from a fantastic restaurant ,"Da Raffeal",right at a Gondolier station,well worth looking up!!.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Clownfish88
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and I with our 2 kids) stayed at this charming hotel for 2 nights in July 2010. We had a big and beautiful room with a king size bed and a day bed (a sofa bed) with a pull out bed underneath a sofa....that meant that the kids had their own proper beds :) The bathroom was newly renovated and very clean. The hotel was very well maintained. Breakfast was included with our room reservation. There was plenty of selection of hot and cold food for breakfast...you have to try the apricot filled croissants. The service was fantastic...the floor desk staff completely spoiled us. The hotel is located in an excellent location....close enough to San Marco square but tucked away from all the crowds. I absolutely loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “...the Magic Remains”
Reviews.Author: Mirene-Mirene
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Dellâ€™Opera twice, I can find only one real â€œfaultâ€� with it: now Iâ€™m willing to stay nowhere else but at this elegant hotel in the heart of the magnificent city which is Venice. This heart beats fast and loud in Pizza San Marco but here, a few steps away, near La Fenice opera house its pace gets suprisingly quiet and makes you feel soothed and relaxed. Dellâ€™Opera has some irresistible Charm. You start feeling it with the quote of Henry James from their site - â€œTime goes by but the magic remainsâ€� and it does remain when you come here. This charm hides between the folds of the heavy curtains on the windows overlooking the little canal Rio delle Veste, it lies on the marble floor of some rooms (youâ€™ll be really proud to find out that itâ€™s similar to the floor in Palazzo Ducale in Venice, Pinacoteca di Brera in Milan or Villa Carlotta in Tremezzo!) The charm sleeps in their comfortable beds, basks under the lampshades, reflects in the mirrors in wide golden frames. It goes up the stairs to the little terrace which suddenly opens to your eyes the dome of the impressive church of Santa Maria della Salute. Yes, Dellâ€™Opera has style and elegance. And thanks to the great people who work here, this style and elegance get a breath of life, the most precious thing, â€“ as itâ€™s not the a/c or tasty croissants or good decor (all of those you can find at Dellâ€™Opera) that makes me come back again. And again. (For my first review see â€œHotel Dellâ€™Opera â€“ Amore Mio!â€�)

Reviews.Title: “the best choice in venice!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dimitriosp
Reviews.Content: we stay at the hotel last week,and we are fully satisfied.close to piazza san marco,next to la fenice,above the antico martini bar,peaceful place,excellent cleaning,great breakfast and very heplfull stuff!!!!!!just perfect!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location & Accomodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: Wilbur1226
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice for 1 night at the Hotel Dell' Opera, they upgraded us to a suite which was absolutely beautiful. We wished that we could've stayed longer. Our windows overlooked the canal and bridge in front the hotel, it was very romantic. The hotel itself is spectacular, it's brand new with great old world details. The location was great too, we took the water bus to the San Marco stop and it was about a 10 minute walk from the water bus stop. The hotel is centrally located from all your main attractions in Venice and with a map, it's not hard to find. It's right off the main shopping st. And last but not least the staff at the Hotel Dell' Opera was superb, very accomodating and helpful with dinner suggestions. I would most definitely stay at the Hotel Dell' Opera again and recommend to anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: badevilninja
Reviews.Content: Spacious room with fantastic view, clean, friendly staff and reasonably priced - recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: HarryIC
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel with my girlfriend for one night. We booked it last minute on lastrooms and got a room for $100 (supposedly reduced from $380). (UK Sterling actually, but I cannot find a Sterling sign on this keyboard). I have no complaints about this hotel, but feel that all the 5 star reviews are a little generous. Yes the location is great, but I don't think the hotel is all that special. The room was a decent size (we didn't get a canal view) and the bathroom was nice and modern (the shower was pitiful but I guess plumbing isn't the best in old Venice so that might be the same everywhere). The bed was two twins pulled together, but it was still comfortable and not a problem. The room was nice, not that different from the photos on here, but I wouldn't say it was 5 star worthy. We arrived at midnight and left after breakfast so didn't really speak to the staff much, so perhaps the service was lovely, but we didn't really have long enough there to notice anything different from any other hotel in their attitude. Breakfast itself was standard fare, though the blood orange juice and apricot croissants were very nice - though the coffee wasn't so great and the fruit a little tired. Actually the only not amazing coffee i've had so far in Italy, though I think if you asked the waitress would make you something better than the stuff in the jug. There was nothing special about the breakfast, nothing Italian or different from what you'd get anywhere. So as I say a perfectly serviceable no frills hotel, and maybe I am expecting too much, but for $100 it seemed a little pricey for just bed & breakfast (no swimming pool or any other facilities) though in fairness Venice isn't cheap so it was fine, but if i'd actually paid $380 then i'd be really upset. It was fine for the night and I have no complaints, just don't expect anything grand. Venice however is one of the most amazing cities i've ever visited and would definitely go back and spend more time there. I would stay at this hotel again if I was in a rush, but I'd look for something better first if I had more time to plan.

Reviews.Title: “A place where the people make you feel special, in the most special of cities.”
Reviews.Author: TWadson
Reviews.Content: We were aware that there is much to experience in Venice. Giovanni, and Jason, answered our specific menu and sightseeing questions with ease, humor and accuracy. We were able to make the most of our two days there, we ate well and when in the hotel we felt comfortable, welcome and were able to rejuvenate for the next event.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: jonesl757
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous 3 night stay at this lovely hotel. Exceptionally clean ,very friendly staff and terrific central location Ivan greeted us on our arrival and showed us to our room and delivered our bags moments later .Nothing was too much trouble for him . There was high water on our first evening which did catch us out but will be one of the most memorable moments .We roared with laughter when we went paddling !!!! Even the waiters came out to see what was so funny . Jason was also very helpful and witty .You couldnt fault any of the staff .Lovely continental breakfast including ham,salami,cereals ,bread cakes,eggs cheese and plenty of hot tea and coffee .The orange juice was delicious made with blood oranges We booked through Late Great Deals /Travel Republic and saved hundreds . Overall a brilliant hotel only one little niggle is the bar area was being refurbished but we were so worn out from sightseeing it wasn't any real problem Had a fabulous trip to Murano,Burano and Torcello .Very hard sell in Marano but a lovely glass blowing demonstartion .Burano had multicoloured houses and famous for its lace Torcello was our favorite though !!! We only reached thr first cafe and Prosecco on draught and a huge piece of Tiramisu what more could you want .I did hear the churches were spectacular but we didnt reach that far lol If you ever get the chance to visit Venice I would very highly recommend the Hotel Dell Opera

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, amazing service, amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Sybiathriall
Reviews.Content: First of all when we got there check in was smooth and easy! The concerige brought our bags to the room for us so was relaxing from the get go! Told us if we needed anything they were downstairs! One of the days the canal flooded and we didnt expect it and the hotel had wellies for when this happened and told us when to expect to go down which was to a tee! The location was perfect because you are 5 mins walk from san marco and its in a really quiet area. There is a wine bar beside the hotel which is good if you want a late night drink also! and its reasonably priced! Coming from the airport waterbus it is a 5 min walk and a bit tricky to find at first but thats just venice full stop until you get your bearings! The room was very clean and looked very modern which is why i booked it and what you see in the photos is what you get. There is not one bad thing i can say about this place and if i plan to go back to venice i will definatly be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lady_Porsche
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not easy to find, but once we got our bearings, found it to be in a perfect location down a quietish alley not to far from everything. We stayed during aqua alta and watching the gondolas try to get the boats under the bridge from our bedroom window was highly entertaining!! The breakfast room was small but very well staffed by highly attentive waitresses. The room was simply furnished but very stylish and the bathroom was small but looked very high end. Having a min fridge was a plus! We will always stay here when in Venice... I hope to return very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Elaine101
Reviews.Content: We had a Standard room, which had a big double bed and the kids on a sofabed. Even with the sofabed up the room still felt spacious. The decor had a lovely period feel, all dark wood and stone, and we had a view of the canal outside the window. The only tiny niggle was the number of coathangers in the wardrobe - only four ! Breakfast was a buffet with cereal, cold meats, cheese, bread, cake, fruit, croissants - all very nice. The hotel is only a few minutes from St Mark's but far enough away that you feel like you have explored a bit. I thought it was excellent value for the price we paid. The restaurant next door is good too, not too expensive by Venice standards and much bigger than it looks from the outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Andred68
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in an old building next to a canal. A few minutes walk from Piazza San Marco & the Doge's Palace (and the San Marco landing for the boat from the airport). Good large room with internet (though via a provided cable as the WiFi was too weak except in the lobby & breakfast room). Good breakfast & helpful English-speaking staff. Good restaurants nearby. Expensive, but worth it to be in the heart of San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous for our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: hollymist
Reviews.Content: The hotel was only 2 minutes walk from St Marks Square, a spectacular traditional building with beautiful furniture. We had a canal view with 2 huge windows looking out onto the canal in traditional style. The room was huge, although the bathroom a little small it was beautifully renovated. The hotel includes continental breakfast which was adequate to set you up for the days sightseeing. The hotel very kindly provided a bottle of sparkling wine when they discovered it was our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Dell'Opera - Amore mio!”
Reviews.Author: Mirene-Mirene
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! I fell in love with it just after seeing its photos in the Internet and I was even more impressed when I came there for 4 nights in the middle of September. I hope my detailed review will help you to make a decision, but be sure - Hotel Dellâ€™Opera is a good choice! LOCATION. This charming elegant hotel is just in the centre of Venice, in San Marco area which makes it a perfect place for exploring the city. At the same time it's off the touristsâ€™ track, so just after you leave a pretty busy street calle Larga XXII Marzo, turn into a little passage leading to a narrow romantic canal Rio delle Veste and come over a bridge youâ€™ll find yourself in an absolutely quiet lovely place - and this is where the hotel is situated. The loudest â€œnoiseâ€� you hear comes from the singing gondoliers (but I suppose nobody will mind that!:) Moreover, being a solo female traveler I felt pretty comfortable coming back late at night, as it is in an absolutely safe area. And the main thing for me was the opera! Iâ€™m an opera-lover and this time I came to Venice specially to listen to La Traviata at the La Fenice opera house â€“ itâ€™s just a few meters away and in the evening before the performance you can watch an interesting procession of smartly-dressed people coming to the opera. Think of the tickets in advance and youâ€™ll get a fantastic experience! ROOMS AND INTERIOR. The main feature of this hotel is elegance. Soft colours - brown, beige, white, - soft light, spacious rooms (I was alone in a double room overlooking Rio delle Veste (302) which is on the top floor under the roof, but I can say that for two people it is great, too.) In comparison with many other hotels in Venice (or at least their photos) this hotel can boast of modern interior which I really appreciated, as you can find a lot of antique style in the city itself - and I had no wish to have tired old-looking things in my room. Everything I needed was there â€“ a safe, a mini-bar, 6 towels and a charming view of the canal below â€“ so I could even sing â€œSanta Luciaâ€� together with the gondoliers passing by (and I really did, actually!) STAFF. Oh, what a pleasant company to talk to! I spoke Italian with Giovanni who was also giving me useful tips and teaching me some of the Italian phrases I needed, English withâ€¦emâ€¦ Jason, Jesuâ€¦. - (mamma mia, it seems to me I didnâ€™t catch his name right and, perhaps, made a mistake in my direct review to the hotel â€“ sorry!), Russian with Ivanâ€¦ Everyone was so helpful and nice to me, and I really felt being a friend not a guest. BREAKFAST. Well, Iâ€™m not a heavy eater so Iâ€™m not the best person to ask. But you can get all you need there â€“ juice, fruit, cereals, cakes, bunsâ€¦ cafÃ© latte served in tall glassesâ€¦ cappuccino with the foam of whipped milk which you can â€œeatâ€� with a spoon. If you come to breakfast early youâ€™ll find yourself alone in their charming breakfast room, so try to make yourself noticed by the staff or you risk having eaten everything before you are served with hot drinks. It happened to me once but I eat little and do it fast â€“ so perhaps that was the problem. SURROUNDINGS AND RECOMMENDATIONS. La Fenice is a must for all lovers of music. Even if you donâ€™t have a reservation, thereâ€™s a chance you can get a good ticket just one day before the performance (I reserved mine half a year in advance, but on the next day after my first Traviata I dropped into the box office and bought one more ticket to listen to it for the second time!) What I also recommend is to listen to Vivaldi in the church of San Vidal â€“ a great pleasure and very relaxing after a day of sightseeing. Thereâ€™s a great choice of restaurants and cafes in Venice. The closest to the hotel is a little restaurant VinoVino where I came 3 times and was glad to receive fast service and a pleasant meal. If you want to go away from Venice for a day â€“ choose Vicenza, Bassano-del-Grappa or (a bit further) Verona. Among the islands of Venice I recommend Burano with its picturesque bright houses (about 1 hour by vaporetto from Fondamenta Nuove) AND AGAIN I would like to say that I was really happy to stay at the Hotel Dellâ€™Opera and can surely recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, nice service”
Reviews.Author: ditya6um
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel with friendly staff. Be sure not to buy a map of Venice for 2.5 Euro because you will get one once you check into the hotel. The location is great - 6 minutes walk to San Marco and 10 minutes walk to Rialto bridge. The best way to reach this hotel is to get off the water taxi at Giglio (one stop before San Marco) stop and then ask someone for La Fenice theater. The hotel is right there. I asked a person at the Venice airport in the tourist information center and she told me exactly how to get here. Hotel also has the free breakfast from 7:30 AM - 10 AM. The hotel also has a small elevator,so you won't need to carry the luggage through the stairs. Overall we had a very nice stay in this hotel. Jason was especially very helpful. Oh well, the breakfast was included, so that was the icing.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fleet7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliant. Slightly tricky to find but I'm sure that is the usual with Venice. We arrived by water taxi though - a great way to arrive and sure beats the hassle of wandering around with your luggage looking for the hotel. The location is literally one block from St Marks Square but there is none of the tourist noise associated with being so close. The hotel is reasonably new - I think it was opened just this year - and is immaculate. Both men on reception were brilliant. Extremely helpful and funny. We booked a standard room (no canal view) and were given the most gorgeous room on the 3rd floor with its own private terrace. It was extremely large with a generous bathroom (no shower but a shower nozzle in the bath). There was wi-fi but we couldn't get it to work unfortunately. Breakfast was included and it was a typical Italian breakfast, croissant, cake, cereal, fruit, meat and cheese. Very nice though. This really was a great hotel and I would recommend it to anyone staying in Venice. We loved Venice and I think it was in because we stayed in such a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, value, and location!”
Reviews.Author: ETG8R
Reviews.Content: Hotel dell'Opera was exactly what we were looking for during our Honeymoon stay in Venice (thanks, TripAdvisor, for the recommendation). The hotel is perfectly located within a short walk from Piazza San Marco but not in a crazy busy (touristy) location. From the moment you walk in the door, you are greeted by a wonderful staff in a great (renovated) looking hotel. Our room was updated but in a classy, traditional way (nice to have the glamor of Venice without the old, dated look that many other hotels offer). We were treated with a welcome bottle of prosecco and a congratualtory letter which was a great touch. We loved the furniture, view of the canal, and everyting the room offered. The only negative was the lack of a shower (the tub had a shower head but no curtain), but we found a way to make the most of it. The front desk staff made great recommendations and helped arrange transportation throughout our stay. The gondola ride we took right outside the front door is a must (being on the smaller canals is more romantic yet you still do a brief stint on the grand canal by the Rialto Bridge). Breakfast was very good and offered a nice selection. If you decide not to stay at the Gritti Palace or some other high end hotel, this place is the perfect hotel for an excellent Venice experience. Stroll out to San Marco in the morning before the tourists take over and enjoy getting lost in the area's back streets. Venice is such a unique and romantic city and Hotel dell'Opera offers its guests a wonderful place to call home while visiting.
